channel.title: Antiflood & colors in yell
channel.description:
I know, another topic... But okay... I'm using a 317 server. And I'm not using Delta. I'm using the source of Pur3 Pk Ftw. Questions: [b]Question 1:[/b] How can I make antiflood? So you can only send one message in two seconds?
[b]Question 2:[/b] How can I do colors in yell? For example: ^[OWNER] - Robin: Message...
[s][b]Question 3:[/b] Whats wrong with this code?: There's one problem: everything is going good, BUT if I send an alert, the first 2 letters are not visible. For example: The text was: alert This is a test. This should print out on the screen: [~!ALERT~]: This is a test. But that isn't so. It is: [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2m5xna8.jpg[/img]. Help?[/s] [b][u]SOLVED[/u][/b]
Thanks in advance.
Kind regards, Robin (Robintje1)

item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

ranger squad:

No, not with @dre@ @gre@, etc.

When you use the sendMessage method you can’t use @red@ and them colors, try it. That’s all client side, you have to implement that yourself.

item.title: Antiflood & colors in yell
item.dc:creator: @Robintje1 Robintje1
item.description:
@Robintje1 wrote:

Yell don’t works now… Whats wrong?:

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 3 && playerRights == 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "@red@[OWNER] - @gre@"+ playerName +": @dbl@" +command.substring(5); }
Only Owners can yell… Thats why there only stands [OWNER]. What’s up with this code?

Read full topic

item.title: Antiflood & colors in yell
item.dc:creator: @shadytheone shadytheone
item.description:
@shadytheone wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:13, topic:271712”][code] if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights == 3) {
String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "@red@Owner @gre@"playerName + ": @dbl@"
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (command.length() > 5 && playerRights == 2) {
            String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "@blu@Admin @red@"playerName + ": @dbl@"
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (command.length() > 5 && playerRights == 1) {
            String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "@whi@Mod @red@"playerName + ": @dbl@"
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (command.length() > 5 && playerRights == 0) {
            String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } // all of this code was made by Ranger Squad cuz he pwns ur mamma.

[/code][/quote]

doesnt work like 12 errors , and im not feeling like posting the errors why dont u look if it works before u post the code…

Read full topic

item.title: Antiflood & colors in yell
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

if (command.startsWith("alert") && playerRights >= 1) {
    String[] cmd = command.split(" ");
    if(cmd.length == 2) {
        try {
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll ="[~!ALERT!~]: "+cmd[1];
	    sendMessage("You have successfully sent an announcement.");
        } catch(Exception e) {
	    sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use ::alert [ANNOUNCEMENT].");
        }
    } else {
        sendMessage("Length Error.");
    }
}

Try this.

Read full topic

item.title: Antiflood & colors in yell
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Robintje1:

None works. I tried: 1-2-3-4-5-6-7-9-10. (Not 8, because that’s the default.)

Should be six, because;

Alert is five characters and the space is an extra character. That makes six.

if (command.startsWith("alert") && playerRights >= 1) {
    try {
        String announcement = command.substring(6);
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll ="[~!ALERT!~]: "+announcement;
	sendMessage("You have successfully sent an announcement.");
    } catch(Exception e) {
	sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use ::alert [ANNOUNCEMENT].");
    }
}

Try that.

Read full topic

Making it 10 would make it worse not better.

String announcement = command.substring(6);
